title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/advanced-search-plus
description: AdvancedSearchPlus: Adds some powerfull search tools
author: Mario Pietsch
readme: * Adds the "Advanced Search" tab also to the right sidebar * Replaces the default search option with an icon * Adds a "+" button to the advanced search function ** Allows to pin existing search settings to a new tab ---- ''Important'': This plugin modifies several core templates <$list filter="[[$:/plugins/wikilabs/advanced-search-plus]plugintiddlers[]prefix[$:/core/]] $:/AdvancedSearch $:/tags/AdvancedSearch"><$link to=<>><>

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/bundler
description: Bundler - Simple UI to create tiddler bundles
author: pmario
readme:
* Documentation and more can be found at: https://wikilabs.github.io/#bundler
* The position of the "Bundles" tab can be selected in the $:/ControlPanel
* There are 2 version of bundles
** Bundle lists
** Filtered Bundles ... which have to be activated by the user
* The filter examples can be live tested, clicking on the number besides the "export button"
* The Bundler can bundle itself into a bundle :-).
* You can create several "selections". Those combinations are persistently stored for reuse. 
* Bundle lists can be built up, over time. Just as the TW evolves. 
* The "Enable Import Bundle" option lets you collect / log imported tiddlers and create a new bundle, for future use.
* This plugin only works with TW >= 5.1.14 since we use the "enlist" operator which has been added in 5.1.14
* It's easy to add the bundle configuration to the bundle itself eg: 
** If the bundle is named: `tagged-test.bundle`, the filter can look like this: `[tag[test]] tagged-test.bundle`
* Have a closer look at the ~$:/ControlPanel: Bundles tab for more [[settings|$:/plugins/wikilabs/bundler/ui/ControlPanel/bundler-config]].

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/custom-markup
name: Custom Markup
description: Adds a possibilty to style text content with wikitext syntax
readme:
Adds a possibilty to style text content with wikitext syntax

It's possible to manipulate the rules behaviour with: 

`\rules only ticktext`
`\rules excpet ticktext`

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/edit-tabs
description: Internal link- or edit-buttons are added to tabs if selected
author: Mario Pietsch
readme:
This plugin adds a little link icon to every tab.

''Important:'' This plugin changes the core tabs macro.

! Link-to-Tabs Settings

{{$:/core/ui/ControlPanel/Settings/edit-tabs}}

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/field-search
description: 'Field Search' tab is added to search results
author: Mario Pietsch

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/info-session
description: Info button, with session persistent open/closed status
author: Mario Pietsch
readme:
* This plugin provides a tiddler info button, with a persistent open/close status ''for one browser session''.
* The status is saved in a system "$:/state/popup" variable. 
** This means, if you reload the TW, the status is gone, sice they are not stored by default!

''Important:''

* This plugin changes the core tiddler: $:/core/ui/Buttons/info

----

If you want persistent state variables, you need to ''add'' the "persistent-states" plugin ''and'' modify the ~ViewTemplate. The ''slant-01 theme" provides this functionality.

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/info-tagmap
description: Adds a Tag-Map tab to the tiddler info section
author: Mario Pietsch
readme:
This plugin adds a new tab to the tiddler info section. It's a multi column list of all tiddler tags plus all tagged tiddlers.

This plugin doesn't change any core templates.

The code below can be copied into the tag tiddlers.

```
All tiddlers tagged: {{!!title}}

<<list-links filter:"[tag{!!title}]">>
```

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/markdown-it
description: Markdown parser (Commonmark compatible)
author: pmario
readme:
The plugin version mirrors the markdown-it library version!

This is a WikiLabs plugin for parsing Markdown text, based on the [[markdown-it|https://markdown-it.github.io/]] project.

It is completely self-contained, and doesn't need an Internet connection in order to work. It works both in the browser and under Node.js.

[[Source code can be found here!|https://github.com/wikilabs/plugins/tree/master/wikilabs]]

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/multicol-dropdown
description: MultiColumn Dropdown with flex-box CSS only
author: Mario Pietsch
readme:
! Overview

* This plugin changes most dropdown dialogs into multi column dialogs, with CSS only.
* This plugin is handy, if you have eg: ''a lot of tags''

! Important

This plugin does ''not'' change any core templates!

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/new-tiddler-from-search
description: New Tiddler from Search - minimal interface
author: Mario Pietsch
readme:
This plugin provides a minimal "new Tiddler" interface, if a search doesn't return any results. There are 2 buttons.

* {{$:/core/images/cancel-button}} .. Clear the temporary template tiddler
* {{$:/core/images/done-button}} .. Save the tiddler

''Important'': This plugin overwrites core template tiddlers:

* $:/core/ui/DefaultSearchResultList

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/space-space-newline
name: Space Space Newline
description: Adds a new rule to create hard linebreaks
readme:
Adds a wikitext rule to create hard linebreaks with `<space><space><newLine>` or `<space><space><backslash>`

```
There are 2 spaces and 1 linebreak at the end of this line  
So we should see 2 lines
```

>There are 2 spaces and 1 linebreak at the end of this line  
So we should see 2 lines

---

```
There are 2 spaces and a backslash at the end of this line  \
So we should see 2 lines
```

>There are 2 spaces and a backslash at the end of this line  \
So we should see 2 lines

---

```
If you want to have a visible backslash at the end of this line \  
You need to add 2 spaces at the end of the line
```

>If you want to have a visible backslash at the end of this line \  
You need to add 2 spaces after the backslash


It's possible to manipulate the rules behaviour with:

`\rules only ssnl`  
`\rules excpet ssnl`

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/speciallinks
name: Speciallinks
description: Camel_Case wikilinks are possible
readme: Allow Camel_Case links

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/tocP
description: Table of Contents - parent field based
author: Mario Pietsch
readme:
This plugin contains several "Table of Content" macros, that have the same parameters as the core toc macro. The main difference is, that it doesn't use tags to create the TOC scructure. It uses a "parent" field in so called "child - tiddlers". ''Detailed Documentation'' More details about this plugin can be found at: https://wikilabs.github.io/editions/tocP More plugins, themes and editions can be found at: https://wikilabs.github.io/ ''Important'' These macros are intended to be "drop in replacement" of the core macros. ... They have the exact same parameter names. Instead of "parent" it still uses "tag" as the first parameter. ''Usage'' ```
<>
<>
<>
<>
<>
``` ''Simple Configuration'' * Enable / Disable the inline "New Child" button ** {{$:/plugins/wikilabs/tocP/toggle-new-child-button}} ''Known Problems'' * The "tabbed" versions don't show the "New Child" buttons * Color customisation isn't possible atm

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link
description: uni-link: Enhances the prettylink-parser
name: uni-link
author: Mario Pietsch
readme:
\define createExampleTiddlers() <$button> <$action-sendmessage $message="tm-new-tiddler" title="tiddler-with-caption" caption="Short Caption"/> <$action-sendmessage $message="tm-new-tiddler" title="tiddler-with-subtitle" subtitle="Tiddler With Subtitle Only Defined"/> <$action-sendmessage $message="tm-new-tiddler" title="tiddler-with-subtitle-and-caption" subtitle="Tiddler With Subtitle And Caption - using subtitle" caption="capt.ion"/> <$action-sendmessage $message="tm-new-tiddler" title="tiddler-with-alias" aliases="alias" caption="alias-caption" subtitle="alias-subtitle" my-field="alias my-field"/> <$action-sendmessage $message="tm-new-tiddler" title="test-links" text={{$:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link/backlinks-template!!text}}/> Create "uni-link" example tiddlers! \end \define deleteExampleTiddlers() <$button> <$action-deletetiddler $tiddler="tiddler-with-caption"/> <$action-deletetiddler $tiddler="tiddler-with-subtitle"/> <$action-deletetiddler $tiddler="tiddler-with-subtitle-and-caption"/> <$action-deletetiddler $tiddler="tiddler-with-alias"/> <$action-deletetiddler $tiddler="test-links"/> Delete example tiddlers! \end !! Important This plugin overwrites the core tiddler: $:/core/ui/TiddlerInfo/References ''This uni-link version is compatible with ~TiddlyWiki >= V5.1.22'' If you need to use it with TW <= V5.1.21 you'll need to use an older version, which is available at: https://wikilabs.github.io/#GettingStarted !! Video * https://youtu.be/IelDdM7iXrA !! Uni-link * A new wikitext parsing rule, that calls the global [["uni-link" macro|$:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link/uni-link-macro]], instead of referencing the tiddler name. * It substitues the following tiddler fields: ''subtitle'', ''caption'' and ''title''. The $:/ControlPanel contains a new tab, that lets you define the behaviour of the uni-link macro. Default is ''title''. So there is no difference between the default setting of the plugin and the default behaviour in unmodified ~TiddlyWiki. !! Alias * Alias Link Syntax ** `[[anything|?]]` ... link to the tiddler that contains the alias: `anything` ** `[[anything|?t]]` ... link to alias anything, but display the tiddler ''title'' ** `[[anything|?c]]` ... link to alias anything, but display the tiddler ''caption'' ** `[[anything|?s]]` ... link to alias anything, but display the tiddler ''subtitle'' ** `[[anything|?my-field]]` ... link to alias anything, but display the tiddler-field named ''my-field'' ** If a field doesn't exist, it shows the "alias-text" as used with `[[anything|?]]` ** using [[aka-makros|$:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link/aka-macros]] for tiddler alias handling * Alias Backlinks ** open the tiddler (i)nfo area: References * Filter Operators: ** `is[alias]` ... extends the core `is` operator see: [[https://tiddlywiki.com/#is Operator]] ** `all[aliases]` ... extends the core `all` operator see: [ext[https://tiddlywiki.com/#all Operator]] ** `[aliasbacklinks[]]` ... shows a list of all tiddlers that contain alias links ** `[[?]aliasbacklinks[]sort[title]]` ... shows a list of tiddlers that contain undefined alias links * Right-Sidebar: More tab: [[Aliases|$:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link/ui/MoreSideBar/Aliases]] ** [[Sorted by Alias|$:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link/ui/MoreSideBar/Aliases/byAlias]] ** [[Sorted by Tiddler Title|$:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link/ui/MoreSideBar/Aliases/byTitle]] ** [[Undefined Aliases|$:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link/ui/MoreSideBar/Aliases/undefined]] * uni-link $:/ControlPanel setting * [[uni-fields|$:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link/uni-fields.js]] widget, that allows us to assign CSS classes based on tiddler fields existence. !! Installation * You can drag & drop import this link: $:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link
!! Link Styling * Uni-links are styled like this: $:/plugins/wikilabs/uni-link/styles !! Examples You can use the following buttons to create example tiddlers! <> -- <>

title: $:/plugins/wikilabs/webdav-lm
description: WebDav PUT saver - takes precednece
author: Mario Pietsch
readme:
''Important:'' This plugin takes precedence over the core webDav PUT saver!

This saver uses `last-modified` and `if-unmodified-since` HTTP header attributes, to detect file inconsistencies,
which allows the server to activate server-side file compression. 

The core PUT saver uses etags, which don't work, if server-side file compression is active.
